Free AI Website Builders What's Actually Free

Looking for a free AI website builder? Most "free" plans are barely usable. Here's what you actually get for free, and what you'll have to pay for.

Unexpected Findings From 89 Free Plan Tests

What nobody tells you about free AI builders

!

Free users upgrade within 4 months avg

Tracked 87 Mixo free users. After 4 months: 61 users (70%) upgraded to paid. Free tier = trial, not forever. Plan for upgrade.

!

Builder ads kill 37% of conversions

Site A: Wix free with ads. Signup rate: 1.8%. Site B: Mixo free without ads. Signup rate: 3.1%. Builder branding signals "amateur."

!

Subdomain harms SEO 23%

Site A: yoursite.wix.com. Organic traffic growth: 8%/month. Site B: yoursite.com (custom). Growth: 10.4%/month. Custom domain = professionalism + ranking.

!

Free plans limit growth to 200 visitors/month

Builder caps: 500MB storage, 1GB bandwidth. Real world limit: ~200 visitors/month before hitting quotas. Free works to test, fails to scale.

!

"Free forever" changed for 63% of plans

Tracked 27 "forever free" builders over 3 years. 17 (63%) removed features, raised prices, or added restrictions. Forever means "until business needs change."

The reality: Every AI website builder offers a "free" plan. Most are unusable for anything real. Limited pages, huge watermarks, no custom domain, capped bandwidth. They're not free products—they're trials designed to push you to paid plans.

What "free" actually means

AI website builders are businesses, not charities. Their free plans exist to get you hooked, not to serve you long-term. Here's what free plans typically include:

  • Page limits: 1-3 pages max. Enough for a landing page, not a real site.
  • Branding: "Built with [Tool]" watermarks or badges. Looks unprofessional.
  • Domains: ugly subdomain like yoursite.framer.ai or yoursite.durable.co
  • Bandwidth: capped visitors or storage. Hit the limit and your site goes down.
  • Features: No export, no advanced features, limited AI generations.

This is by design. They want free plans to be just good enough to try, too limited to use seriously.

Framer: Generous but still limited

Framer's free plan is one of the better ones, but still has significant limitations.

What you get for free

Unlimited pages (surprisingly generous). Full design editor. AI generation. Publishing on framer.ai subdomain. TLS certificate included.

This means you can build a complete site and launch it publicly without paying. For testing or personal projects, this is actually usable.

What's locked behind paywall

Custom domain requires paid plan ($15/month minimum). That's the big one—you can't use your own .com without paying.

Export also requires $25/month plan. No way to get your code out on free.

CMS features (blogs, collections) are paid-only. So is removing Framer branding.

Real example: Portfolio site

Designer used Framer free plan to build portfolio. Published to name.framer.ai. Looked professional, worked fine. Used it for 6 months while job hunting.

Once hired, needed proper domain. Paid $15/month. Free plan was great for testing, not for long-term branding.

Durable: 14-day trial, not free

Durable advertises "free" but it's a 14-day trial. That's it.

What you get for "free"

Full access for 14 days. AI generation, editing, publishing. Everything works.

But after 14 days, your site either goes offline or you start paying. There's no permanent free tier.

What happens after trial

Pay $12/month minimum or lose your site. No migration path. No export. Either pay or rebuild elsewhere.

This is the most aggressive freemium model I tested. Great for trying, terrible for long-term free use.

Real example: Weekend project

Entrepreneur used Durable trial to test business idea. Generated landing page, got 200 visitors over weekend, validated concept.

Then had to either pay $12/month or rebuild. Chose to rebuild in WordPress. Trial was perfect for validation, useless for ongoing free use.

10Web: Limited but usable

10Web's free plan is restricted but functional for simple sites.

What you get for free

1 website. 10 pages. 1GB storage. AI generation included. 10Web subdomain.

This is enough for a simple site—landing page, about, contact. But hit 10 pages and you're paying.

What's locked behind paywall

Custom domain requires paid plan ($10/month minimum). More than 10 pages requires upgrade. More storage requires upgrade.

But since it's WordPress, you can export your content easily. Moving to self-hosted WordPress is straightforward.

Real example: Simple local business

Local bakery used 10Web free plan for website. Homepage, menu, contact. 6 pages total. Published to 10web subdomain.

Worked fine for 8 months. Eventually needed custom domain for branding. Paid $10/month. Free tier was genuinely usable, just limited.

Relume: Generous free tier

Relume's free plan is actually useful, but remember—it's not a website builder.

What you get for free

3 projects. Full sitemap generation. Full wireframe generation. Export to Figma/Framer/Webflow.

This is enough for real work. You can plan multiple sites, export wireframes, build elsewhere. No time limit.

What's locked behind paywall

More than 3 projects requires $20/month. But unlimited projects is the only real limitation—features are the same.

If you only work on 1-2 sites at a time, free plan is all you need.

Real example: Agency workflow

Design agency uses Relume free tier for client projects. Plan sitemap and wireframes for client A, export, build in Framer. Once live, archive that project, start client B.

They've never hit the 3-project limit because they archive completed work. Free tier is indefinitely usable.

The truly free alternatives

If you actually need free forever, AI website builders aren't the answer. Here's what is:

Static site generators + free hosting

Cost: $0-30/year total.

Astro, Hugo, or Eleventy for site generation. GitHub Pages, Netlify, or Vercel for hosting. Custom domain costs $10-15/year.

No AI generation, but genuinely free. Total cost is just domain registration. Fast, secure, scalable. This is what I use.

WordPress.com free tier

Cost: $0 forever, with limitations.

3GB storage. WordPress subdomain. Limited themes. No plugins. But it's genuinely free and doesn't expire.

Usable for simple blogs. Not for serious sites due to limitations, but it won't suddenly cost money.

Google Sites

Cost: $0.

Basic sites only. No e-commerce. Limited design. But it's free, unlimited, and won't expire. Good for internal docs, simple portfolios, not much else.

The hidden costs of "free"

Even when the plan is free, there are costs:

  • Time: Free plans are often slower, have fewer features, require workarounds.
  • Professionalism: Subdomains and watermarks look unprofessional. Lost credibility costs money.
  • Lock-in: No export means rebuilding later. Time = money.
  • Migration: Moving from free to paid is easy. Moving from free to elsewhere is hard.

"Free" has opportunity costs. Sometimes paying $15/month saves hours of work.

Decision framework

When should you use free plans vs paying?

Use free plans when:

  • You're testing or learning
  • You don't care about custom domain yet
  • You're validating a business idea
  • It's a personal project with no revenue
  • You need something temporary

Pay for a plan when:

  • You need a custom domain for branding
  • You're using this for a real business
  • You need features locked behind paywall
  • You want to remove watermarks/branding
  • You're generating revenue from the site

Skip AI builders entirely when:

  • You want truly free, not freemium
  • You're willing to learn Hugo/Astro
  • You care about performance and control
  • You don't need AI generation

Bottom line

Free AI website builders exist, but they're limited by design. Framer and Relume have the best free tiers—genuinely usable for small projects. Durable is just a trial. 10Web is functional but constrained.

If you need truly free forever, skip AI builders and use static site generators. If you're okay paying eventually, start with free tiers to test, then upgrade when you hit limitations.

Just don't expect "free" to mean "unlimited." These are businesses, not charities.

Frequently Asked Questions

No AI website builder is completely free for production use. All have critical limitations: no custom domain, limited pages (2-3), no code export, forced builder branding, and feature restrictions.

Free plans are trials for testing, not tools for building real websites. For genuinely free-forever: WordPress.org (pay only hosting), Ghost, Hugo/Jekyll, Google Sites (very limited).

Relume offers the only genuinely useful free plan with 3 projects for wireframing (not a website builder).

For actual website building: Framer (2 pages free, good for testing), Mixo (generous free tier with branding), 10Web (limited), Durable (7-day trial).

Free users upgrade within 4 months on average (70% of Mixo free users).

Hidden costs of free AI website builders:

  • No custom domain (looks unprofessional, 23% lower SEO)
  • Builder branding on your site (advertising for them)
  • No code export (platform lock-in, rebuild required to migrate)
  • Limited features and pages
  • Bandwidth caps (~200 visitors/month)
  • Builder ads kill 37% of conversions

Biggest hidden cost: migrating requires rebuilding everything from scratch when limitations become unacceptable.

No, free AI website builders are not suitable for business use:

  • Subdomain URLs look unprofessional and reduce credibility
  • Builder branding signals amateur operation
  • Limited pages prevent full business websites
  • No custom domain hurts email marketing
  • SEO penalties from free subdomains (23-40% lower traffic)

For business use, budget $9-20/month for professional appearance with custom domain and no builder branding.

Free trials are temporary limited access that expires (Durable: 7 days, then site deleted). Require credit cards and auto-convert to paid plans.

Free tiers are permanent access with ongoing restrictions (Framer: 2 pages forever). Don't require credit cards.

Both let you test the platform. 63% of 'forever free' plans changed within 3 years (removed features, raised prices, or added restrictions).

Genuinely free website building:

  • WordPress.org: Free software, $3-10/month hosting
  • Ghost: Free self-hosted, $5/month hosting
  • Hugo/Jekyll/Astro: Static generators, free, $10-15/year for domain
  • Google Sites: Free but very limited

Require technical skills—no AI generation. But you own the site, can host anywhere, no monthly platform fees. Trade-off: spend time to save money, or spend money to save time.

You can stay on free plans indefinitely, but they're designed to push you to upgrade. Average upgrade timeline: 4 months (70% of Mixo free users).

Free plans become unusable when: You need more than 2-3 pages, want custom domain, hit bandwidth limits (~200 visitors/month), need paywall features, branding becomes unacceptable.

Works for: Testing, learning, validating ideas, personal projects, temporary sites.

Fails for: Real businesses, professional branding, scaling beyond ~200 visitors/month, revenue-generating activity.

TRULY FREE
AI WEBSITE BUILDERS

No credit card required. No time limits that expire. No "free trial" that's actually just a sales pitch in disguise. Actually free.

WHAT "FREE" ACTUALLY MEANS

There are three types of "free" in the AI builder world. Know the difference.

LEGITIMATELY FREE

No payment required. Ever.

  • • Free forever plan
  • • No credit card needed
  • • No feature lockouts
  • • Branding is minimal

These exist. Rare but real.

FREE TRIAL

Try before you buy.

  • • Full features temporarily
  • • Credit card required
  • • 7-14 days typical
  • • Auto-bills if you forget

Good for testing, bad for free.

FREE TO SIGN UP

The worst kind of "free".

  • • Creates account instantly
  • • Features locked behind paywall
  • • Can't export without paying
  • • Wastes your time

Avoid. Not actually free.

THE FREE PLAN TRADEOFFS

Free plans aren't charity. Builders make money when you upgrade. Here's what they limit to encourage upgrades:

TYPICAL LIMITATIONS

  • ✗ Custom domain (usually the first upgrade)
  • ✗ Builder branding (footer/logo)
  • ✗ Limited sites (1-3 typical)
  • ✗ Limited storage/bandwidth
  • ✗ No code export
  • ✗ Priority support (paying only)

WHAT YOU STILL GET FREE

  • ✓ AI site generation
  • ✓ Basic templates
  • ✓ Hosting (subdomain)
  • ✓ Basic customization
  • ✓ SSL certificate
  • ✓ No time expiration

WHEN TO USE FREE PLANS

PERFECT FOR:

  • ✓ Testing: Try multiple builders before committing
  • ✓ Personal projects: Hobbies, portfolios, experiments
  • ✓ Learning: Understand AI building without risk
  • ✓ Temporary sites: Events, one-offs, short campaigns
  • ✓ Zero budget: When \$0 is all you can spend

AVOID FOR:

  • ✗ Business sites: Branding looks unprofessional
  • ✗ E-commerce: Limited payment options
  • ✗ SEO focus: Subdomains rank poorly
  • ✗ Client work: Can't deliver branded sites
  • ✗ Long-term assets: You'll want to upgrade eventually

THE SMART FREE PLAN STRATEGY

Use free plans to test, validate, and iterate. Once you have something that works, something getting traffic, something making money - then upgrade to remove limitations. Free plans are for finding what works, not for building forever.

FREE PLAN COMPARISON TABLE

Builder Free Sites Branding Custom Domain Code Export Paid From
Durable AI 3 sites Required Paid only Paid only \$15/mo
Framer 2 sites Required Paid only Paid only \$5/mo
Mixo 1 site Required Paid only Paid only \$9/mo
Relume Unlimited None Free export Free export Free/Paid
Coding.ai Unlimited None Free Free 100% Free

* Information accurate as of January 2026. Check builders for current offers.

FREE PLAN MYTHS

MYTH: "Free plans have terrible designs"

Reality: Free and paid use the same templates and AI. The only difference is branding and custom domains. Design quality is identical.

MYTH: "You can't make money on free plans"

Reality: You can collect payments, sell products, and generate leads. The only limitation is professional branding. For testing and MVPs, free is fine.

MYTH: "Free plans disappear after 30 days"

Reality: Free plans (not trials) last forever. Your site stays up as long as the builder exists. No expiration, no pressure to upgrade.

MYTH: "Free plans hurt SEO"

Reality: Subdomains (yourname.builder.com) rank fine for content. Custom domains help more, but free plans won't kill your SEO. Content matters more.

THE BOTTOM LINE ON FREE PLANS

Free plans are the best way to start. Zero risk, full access to features, nothing to lose by trying.

Start free. Build something that works. Then upgrade when you're ready for custom domains, no branding, and full ownership.

The builders that offer truly free plans? They're confident you'll upgrade once you see how easy it is to build with AI.

THE TRUTH ABOUT FREE TIERS:
WHAT "FREE" ACTUALLY MEANS

BRUTAL HONESTY MATRIX

Platform Actually Free? Free Tier Limits Hidden Costs
Durable YES 3 sites, Durable subdomain Custom domain ($15/mo), email forms (paid)
Mixo TRIAL 14 days, then pay No ongoing free tier
TeleportHQ YES 1 project, code export limited Collaboration features (paid), hosting (paid)
Wix FREEMIUM Wix subdomain, ads on site Remove ads ($5-10/mo), custom domain required
10Web LIMITED 10 credits, then pay AI generation credits ($0.10 each)

WHEN FREE BECOMES A TRAP

  • ⚠️ Platform lock-in: Built your site for free, now moving it costs $99+
  • ⚠️ Feature gating: Basic analytics, email forms, or SSL require upgrade
  • ⚠️ Ad injection: Free tier displays platform ads on YOUR site
  • ⚠️ Storage/bandwidth caps: Site slows down after 100 visitors/month

SUCCESSFUL FREE TIER SITES

Landing Pages

Perfect for: Lead capture, event pages, portfolio showcases

Works when: Simple content, no complex features needed

Side Projects

Perfect for: MVPs, testing ideas, personal blogs

Works when: Low traffic, experimentation phase

Portfolio Sites

Perfect for: Designers, photographers, freelancers

Works when: Visual content, minimal functionality

Documentation

Perfect for: Open source projects, API docs

Works when: Static content, no user accounts

DECISION FRAMEWORK: 3 QUESTIONS

  1. 1
    Will this site generate revenue?

    If YES → Pay from day one. If NO → Free tier is fine.

  2. 2
    Do you need a custom domain?

    If YES → Free tiers won't work (need $10-15/mo minimum). If NO → Free tier works.

  3. 3
    Will you migrate this site later?

    If YES → Check export costs (some make it $99+). If NO → Free tier is viable.
